'Profile' is the debut album by American pianist and arranger Duke Pearson,
featuring performances by Pearson with Gene Taylor and Lex Humphries. It was
recorded in 1959 and released the same year on the Blue Note label. [http://www.jazzdisco.org/duke-pearson/catalog/#blue-note-blp-
4022 Duke Pearson discography] accessed September 6, 2010 Like the
following [[Tender Feelin's]], Profile has been released singularly on CD only
in Japan by Blue Note/EMI. However, at present, it could be found on the twofer
Profile & Tender Feelin's - Duke Pearson Trio issued by Fresh Sound Records in
May 2011. Duke dedicated this album to his mother, Emily Pearson, "the one
responsible for my coming this far." Original 1959 liner notes by Ira
Gitler
categories: Albums recorded at Van Gelder Studio
